iti68:2.1.pli: “Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, rāgo appahīno, doso appahīno, moho appahīno—
iti68:2.1.eng: “Whoever has not given up greed, hate, and delusion

iti68:2.2.pli: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ‘baddho mārassa paṭimukkassa mārapāso yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato’.
iti68:2.2.eng: is said to be trapped. They’re caught in Māra’s snare, and the Wicked One can do with them what he wants.

iti68:2.3.pli: Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, rāgo pahīno, doso pahīno, moho pahīno—
iti68:2.3.eng: Whoever has given up greed, hate, and delusion

iti68:2.4.pli: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ‘abaddho mārassa omukkassa mārapāso na yathākāmakaraṇīyo pāpimato’”ti.
iti68:2.4.eng: is said to be free. They’re released from Māra’s snare, and the Wicked One cannot do with them what he wants.”

iti68:3.3.eng: belong with those who are evolved;

iti69:2.1.pli: “Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā rāgo appahīno, doso appahīno, moho appahīno—
iti69:2.1.eng: “Whoever has not given up greed, hate, and delusion

iti69:2.2.pli: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ‘atiṇṇo samuddaṃ saūmiṃ savīciṃ sāvaṭṭaṃ sagahaṃ sarakkhasaṃ’.
iti69:2.2.eng: is said to have not crossed over the ocean with its waves and whirlpools, its saltwater crocodiles and monsters.

iti69:2.3.pli: Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā rāgo pahīno, doso pahīno, moho pahīno—
iti69:2.3.eng: Whoever has given up greed, hate, and delusion

iti69:2.4.pli: ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ‘atari samuddaṃ saūmiṃ savīciṃ sāvaṭṭaṃ sagahaṃ sarakkhasaṃ, tiṇṇo pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo’”ti.
iti69:2.4.eng: is said to have crossed over the ocean with its waves and whirlpools, its saltwater crocodiles and monsters. Crossed over and gone to the far shore, that brahmin stands on solid ground.”

iti69:3.1.eng: “Those in whom greed, hate, and ignorance

iti69:3.3.eng: have crossed the ocean so hard to cross,

iti69:3.4.eng: with its saltwater crocodiles and monsters, <j>its waves and dangers.

iti69:4.1.eng: They’ve slipped their chains, given up death, and have no attachments.

iti69:4.2.eng: They’ve given up suffering, <j>so there are no more future lives.

iti69:4.3.eng: They’ve disappeared and cannot be defined;

iti69:4.4.eng: they’ve confounded the King of Death, I say.”

iti7:2.1.pli: “Sabbaṃ, bhikkhave, anabhijānaṃ aparijānaṃ tattha cittaṃ avirājayaṃ appajahaṃ abhabbo dukkhakkhayāya.
iti7:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, without directly knowing and completely understanding the all, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.

iti7:2.2.pli: Sabbañca kho, bhikkhave, abhijānaṃ parijānaṃ tattha cittaṃ virājayaṃ pajahaṃ bhabbo dukkhakkhayāyā”ti.
iti7:2.2.eng: By directly knowing and completely understanding the all, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.”

iti70:2.1.pli: “Diṭṭhā mayā, bhikkhave, sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā vacīduccaritena samannāgatā manoduccaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṃ upavādakā micchādiṭṭhikā micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā.
iti70:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, I’ve seen beings who engaged in misconduct by body, speech, and mind, who denounced the noble ones, who had wrong views and acted accordingly.

iti70:2.2.pli: Te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā.
iti70:2.2.eng: At the breaking up of the body, after death, they were reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

iti70:3.1.pli: Taṃ kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, nāññassa samaṇassa vā brāhmaṇassa vā sutvā vadāmi.
iti70:3.1.eng: Now, I don’t say this because I’ve heard it from some other ascetic or brahmin.

iti70:3.2.pli: Diṭṭhā mayā, bhikkhave, sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā vacīduccaritena samannāgatā manoduccaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṃ upavādakā micchādiṭṭhikā micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā.

iti70:3.3.pli: Te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā.

iti70:3.4.pli: Api ca, bhikkhave, yadeva sāmaṃ ñātaṃ sāmaṃ diṭṭhaṃ sāmaṃ viditaṃ tadevāhaṃ vadāmi.
iti70:3.4.eng: I only say it because I’ve known, seen, and realized it for myself.”

iti71:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, I’ve seen beings who engaged in good conduct of body, speech, and mind, who did not denounce the noble ones, who held right view and acted accordingly.

iti72:2.3.pli: Kāmānametaṃ nissaraṇaṃ yadidaṃ nekkhammaṃ, rūpānametaṃ nissaraṇaṃ yadidaṃ āruppaṃ, yaṃ kho pana kiñci bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ paṭiccasamuppannaṃ nirodho tassa nissaraṇaṃ—
iti72:2.3.eng: Renunciation is the escape from sensual pleasures. Formlessness is the escape from form. Cessation is the escape from whatever is created, conditioned, and dependently originated.

iti74:2.1.eng: “These three kinds of children are found in the world.

iti74:2.3.eng: One who betters their birth, one who equals their birth, one who fails their birth.

iti74:3.1.eng: And how does a child better their birth?

iti74:3.3.pli: na buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, na dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, na saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā;
iti74:3.3.eng: have not gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

iti74:3.4.pli: pāṇātipātā appaṭiviratā, adinnādānā appaṭiviratā, kāmesumicchācārā appaṭiviratā, musāvādā appaṭiviratā, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā appaṭiviratā, dussīlā pāpadhammā.
iti74:3.4.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. They’re immoral, of bad character.

iti74:3.6.pli: buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato;
iti74:3.6.eng: has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

iti74:3.7.pli: pāṇātipātā paṭivirato, adinnādānā paṭivirato, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato, musāvādā paṭivirato, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato, sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo.
iti74:3.7.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. They’re ethical, of good character.

iti74:3.8.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, putto atijāto hoti.
iti74:3.8.eng: That’s how a child betters their birth.

iti74:4.1.eng: And how does a child equal their birth?

iti74:4.3.pli: buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā;
iti74:4.3.eng: have gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

iti74:4.4.pli: pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā, adinnādānā paṭiviratā, kāmesumicchācārā paṭiviratā, musāvādā paṭiviratā, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭiviratā, sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā.
iti74:4.4.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. They’re ethical, of good character.

iti74:4.6.pli: buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato;
iti74:4.6.eng: has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

iti74:4.7.pli: pāṇātipātā paṭivirato, adinnādānā paṭivirato, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato, musāvādā paṭivirato, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato, sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo.
iti74:4.7.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. They’re ethical, of good character.

iti74:4.8.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, putto anujāto hoti.
iti74:4.8.eng: That’s how a child equals their birth.

iti74:5.1.eng: And how does a child fail their birth?

iti74:5.3.pli: buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gatā;
iti74:5.3.eng: have gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

iti74:5.4.pli: pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā, adinnādānā paṭiviratā, kāmesumicchācārā paṭiviratā, musāvādā paṭiviratā, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭiviratā, sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā.
iti74:5.4.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. They’re ethical, of good character.

iti74:5.6.pli: na buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, na dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, na saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato;
iti74:5.6.eng: has not gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

iti74:5.7.pli: pāṇātipātā appaṭivirato, adinnādānā appaṭivirato, kāmesumicchācārā appaṭivirato, musāvādā appaṭivirato, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā appaṭivirato, dussīlo pāpadhammo.
iti74:5.7.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants. They’re immoral, of bad character.

iti74:5.8.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, putto avajāto hoti.
iti74:5.8.eng: That’s how a child fails their birth.

iti74:5.9.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo puttā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
iti74:5.9.eng: These are the three kinds of children found in the world.”

iti75:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti75:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, these three individuals are found in the world.

iti75:2.3.eng: One like a rainless cloud, one who rains locally, one who rains all over.

iti75:3.1.eng: And how is an individual like a rainless cloud?

iti75:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sabbesaññeva na dātā hoti, samaṇabrāhmaṇakapaṇaddhikavanibbakayācakānaṃ annaṃ pānaṃ vatthaṃ yānaṃ mālāgandhavilepanaṃ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṃ.
iti75:3.2.eng: It’s when an individual doesn’t give to anyone at all—whether ascetics and brahmins, paupers, vagrants, supplicants, or beggars—such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.

iti75:3.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo avuṭṭhikasamo hoti.
iti75:3.3.eng: That’s how an individual is like a rainless cloud.

iti75:4.1.eng: And how does an individual rain locally?

iti75:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ekaccānaṃ dātā hoti, ekaccānaṃ na dātā hoti samaṇabrāhmaṇakapaṇaddhikavanibbakayācakānaṃ annaṃ pānaṃ vatthaṃ yānaṃ mālāgandhavilepanaṃ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṃ.
iti75:4.2.eng: It’s when an individual gives to some but not to others—whether ascetics and brahmins, paupers, vagrants, supplicants, or beggars—such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.

iti75:4.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo padesavassī hoti.
iti75:4.3.eng: That’s how an individual rains locally.

iti75:5.1.eng: And how does an individual rain all over?

iti75:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sabbesaṃva deti, samaṇabrāhmaṇakapaṇaddhikavanibbakayācakānaṃ annaṃ pānaṃ vatthaṃ yānaṃ mālāgandhavilepanaṃ seyyāvasathapadīpeyyaṃ.
iti75:5.2.eng: It’s when an individual gives to everyone—whether ascetics and brahmins, paupers, vagrants, supplicants, or beggars—such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.

iti75:5.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo sabbatthābhivassī hoti.
iti75:5.3.eng: That’s how an individual rains all over.

iti75:5.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
iti75:5.4.eng: These are the three individuals found in the world.”
